column2: Role and Skill of Physiotherapy            Willingness to work for a Home Care environment.          Need to focus on restoring physical function.          Need to be sensitive to the patients' needs and disabilities and must have excellent communication and motivational skills.          Create positive impact in the prevention of subsequent acute events and support the individual s ability to live independently through targeted interventions aimed at improving balance, strength, coordination and function.          Should personally also be physically fit enough to properly demonstrate the activities in their treatment plans and must possess strong organizational skills.          Should possess either of the areas of expertise: pain management, sports injury management, paediatric therapy, post-operative therapy, arthritis management, neuro or posture correction.          The conditions to be treated are back pain, neck pain, shoulder pain, knee pain, arthritic pain, slipped disc and any other kind of sprains.          Creating an impact on overall patient experience by          Targeting the recovery of physical function of stroke patients through low risk activities resulting in high patient satisfaction.          Providing a service which reduces the risk for poor health outcomes, increases daily living and personal activity.            General Task            New patient assessments, creating care plans, doing regular follow-ups.          Help accident victims, medical patients, and chronically disabled people maintain and improve their physical well-being by designing, implementing, and supervising custom treatment plans.          Supervise patients' health progress and make adjustments to treatment plans as needed.          Help patients maintain or restore flexibility, strength, and range of motion          Help people affected by injury, illness or disability through movement and exercise, manual therapy, education and advice.          They maintain health for people of all ages, helping patients to manage pain and prevent disease.          Maintaining electronic medical records and sharing with other specialties or HOD when required.          Developing protocols for assessment and management.          Maintaining patient database and service details.          Constantly updating knowledge and practical skills in the field of rehabilitation.          Training customer care and sales and marketing team regarding the product.        Assist in implementing and standardizing treatment and assessment protocols. for Short term & Full term Services on Full time or Consultant Basis.          Willing to work as Home Care Nurse on Flexible Shift basis.      MANDATORY - NURSING COUNCIL REGISTRATION IS MANDATORY FROM THE WORKING STATE          Roles & Responsibilites            Attend, administer, monitor, record all medical nursing service calls assigned.          Coordinating with physicians and other team members for creating and evaluating customized care plans.          Educating patients families about the disease and its treatment          Interpret patient information and make critical decisions about needed actions.          Adhering with the protocols, norms, rules and regulations in order to maintain complete medical records          Checking the stock on a regular basis for maintaining the inventory level, and placing orders if required          Managing billing, accountable bill, receipt payable          Maintain Nursing notes and report to the lead          Responsible & accountable for stock provided          Database management of patients and updation          Maintaining reports of patients medical histories, and monitoring changes in their condition          Handover work log during shift

column2: Patient Assessment: Evaluate patients' medical history and physical condition to determine the extent and nature of their injuries or conditions.      Treatment Planning: Develop individualized treatment plans based on patient needs and goals, using various physical therapy techniques and modalities.      Therapeutic Interventions: Administer therapeutic exercises, manual therapy, and other physical therapy modalities to help patients improve their strength, flexibility, balance, and mobility.      Pain Management: Implement techniques to reduce pain, discomfort, and inflammation in patients with acute or chronic pain conditions.      Rehabilitation: Assist patients in recovering from injuries, surgeries, or medical conditions, focusing on functional restoration and independence.      Patient Education: Educate patients on their conditions, treatment plans, and self-management techniques to improve their long-term well-being.      Use of Equipment: Utilize therapeutic equipment and tools, such as ultrasound, electrical stimulation, and heat/cold therapy, to aid in rehabilitation.      Progress Monitoring: Continuously assess and monitor patients' progress, adjusting treatment plans as necessary to achieve desired outcomes.      Documentation: Maintain accurate and up-to-date patient records, including assessment findings, treatment plans, progress notes, and discharge summaries.      Orthopedic Care: Provide care for orthopedic conditions, including post-operative rehabilitation, sports injuries, and musculoskeletal disorders.

column2: Care and Cure Home Healthcare Service is looking for PHYSIOTHERAPIST to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     A physiotherapist, also known as a physical therapist, is a healthcare professional who specializes in the assessment, diagnosis, and treatment of physical impairments, disabilities, and movement disorders     They aim to promote optimal mobility, function, and quality of life for their patients       Here are the key responsibilities and areas of expertise of a physiotherapist:       Assessment and Evaluation: Physiotherapists assess patients through interviews, physical examinations, and review of medical history to identify impairments, functional limitations, and movement disorders     They use various assessment tools and techniques to measure strength, range of motion, balance, coordination, and other relevant factors     Treatment Planning and Implementation: Based on the assessment, physiotherapists develop individualized treatment plans and goals for their patients     They employ a variety of treatment modalities and techniques, such as therapeutic exercises, manual therapy, electrotherapy, heat and cold therapy, and hydrotherapy     They also provide education on self-management techniques and assistive devices if needed     Rehabilitation and Injury Prevention: Physiotherapists assist patients in recovering from injuries, surgeries, or medical conditions that affect their physical function     They design rehabilitation programs to restore mobility, strength, and flexibility, and they guide patients through the recovery process     They also provide education and strategies to prevent future injuries or complications     Pain Management: Physiotherapists utilize various techniques to manage pain and reduce discomfort     This may include manual therapy, soft tissue mobilization, therapeutic modalities, and patient education on pain management techniques and strategies     Functional Training and Conditioning: Physiotherapists help patients improve their functional abilities for everyday activities, work, and sports     They provide exercises and training programs to enhance strength, endurance, balance, coordination, and overall physical performance     Assistive Devices and Adaptations: Physiotherapists assess the need for and provide guidance on the use of assistive devices such as crutches, walkers, canes, orthotics, and prosthetics     They also advise on home modifications and adaptations to promote safety and independence     Patient Education and Counseling: Physiotherapists educate patients and their families about their condition, treatment plans, and self-management techniques     They provide guidance on lifestyle modifications, injury prevention, and ergonomics to optimize function and minimize the risk of further injury or impairment     Collaboration and Referrals: Physiotherapists collaborate with other healthcare professionals, such as physicians, surgeons, occupational therapists, and psychologists, to provide comprehensive care for their patients     They may also refer patients to other specialists or services when necessary     Documentation and Progress Monitoring: Physiotherapists maintain detailed records of patient assessments, treatment plans, progress, and outcomes     They regularly monitor patient progress, adjust treatment plans as needed, and communicate with other healthcare providers to ensure coordinated care
column11: sports, hydrotherapy, physiotherapy, therapy, bpt, yoga, exercise, ortho, orthopedics, pain management, healthcare, counselling, treatment planning, rehabilitation, manual therapy, physical therapy, mobilisation, massage, occupational therapy, neurology, surgery

column2: Ramaiah Memorial Hospital is looking for Dietician to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      Assessment: Dietitians assess an individual's dietary habits, nutritional status, health goals, and any existing health conditions      They use this information to develop personalized nutrition plans      Nutrition Planning: Based on the assessment, dietitians create nutrition plans tailored to meet a person's specific needs and goals      This could include weight management, improving overall health, managing specific medical conditions, or supporting athletic performance      Education and Counseling: Dietitians educate clients about healthy eating practices, portion control, and the nutritional value of different foods      They offer counseling and support to help clients make sustainable dietary changes      Meal Planning: Dietitians assist in meal planning, including developing balanced and nutritious meal options, creating special diets (eg, low-sodium, gluten-free, diabetic-friendly), and providing guidance for meal preparation      Nutritional Support: In healthcare settings, dietitians work with medical teams to provide nutritional support for patients with various medical conditions, including those in hospitals, long-term care facilities, and rehabilitation centers      Specialized Care: Some dietitians specialize in particular areas, such as pediatric nutrition, sports nutrition, renal nutrition, or eating disorders      They provide expertise in these specific fields      Weight Management: Dietitians assist individuals in achieving and maintaining a healthy weight through personalized dietary plans, exercise recommendations, and behavior modification strategies      Chronic Disease Management: They help individuals manage and prevent chronic health conditions such as diabetes, heart disease, hypertension, and gastrointestinal disorders through dietary modifications

patients through the recovery process      They also provide education and strategies to prevent future injuries or complications      Pain Management: Physiotherapists utilize various techniques to manage pain and reduce discomfort      This may include manual therapy, soft tissue mobilization, therapeutic modalities, and patient education on pain management techniques and strategies      Functional Training and Conditioning: Physiotherapists help patients improve their functional abilities for everyday activities, work, and sports      They provide exercises and training programs to enhance strength, endurance, balance, coordination, and overall physical performance      Assistive Devices and Adaptations: Physiotherapists assess the need for and provide guidance on the use of assistive devices such as crutches, walkers, canes, orthotics, and prosthetics      They also advise on home modifications and adaptations to promote safety and independence      Patient Education and Counseling: Physiotherapists educate patients and their families about their condition, treatment plans, and self-management techniques      They provide guidance on lifestyle modifications, injury prevention, and ergonomics to optimize function and minimize the risk of further injury or impairment      Collaboration and Referrals: Physiotherapists collaborate with other healthcare professionals, such as physicians, surgeons, occupational therapists, and psychologists, to provide comprehensive care for their patients      They may also refer patients to other specialists or services when necessary      Documentation and Progress Monitoring: Physiotherapists maintain detailed records of patient assessments, treatment plans, progress, and outcomes      They regularly monitor patient progress, adjust treatment plans as needed, and communicate with other healthcare providers to ensure coordinated care
column11: sports, hydrotherapy, physiotherapy, therapy, bpt, yoga, exercise, ortho, orthopedics, pain management, healthcare, counselling, treatment planning, rehabilitation, manual therapy, physical therapy, mobilisation, massage, occupational therapy, neurology, surgery

column2: Job Description            Medical Care     1. Ensure dialysis adequacy by therapists,conduct monthly investigation through panels to understand areas of improvement in terms of personnel as well as infrastructure.   2. Collaborate with additional support services (Housekeeping, Admin etc.) to provide a safe, clean and secure environment for patient, staff and visitors.   3. Oversee scheduling of dialysis sessions for patients,provide guidance to technicians   4. Evaluate and set standards and protocols for facilities and equipments, and monitor utilization of equipment and supplies (consumables), ensure that the protocol is being adhered to, in the usage of infrastructure.   5. Supervise procurement of all necessary equipment and consumables for the dialysis unit, as and when required   6. Initiate periodic protocol reviews in conjunction with the resident Nephrologists   7. Supervise maintenance / troubleshooting and preventive maintenance activities for the equipment and infrastructure within the unit   8. Provide assistance in the orientation and practice of emergency procedures, fire drill, evacuation procedures and internal/ external disaster plans and procedures.   9. Co-ordinate with Lab Executive for analysis of prescribed tests for dialysis patients   10. Assist the OT Surgeon and Technician in procuring equipment and consumables as and when required.       Patient Care     1. Responsible for safety and comfort of patients; as well as the health and safety of employees assigned in the dialysis unit.   2. Monitor needs of patients (dietary, psychological etc.) and ensure they are referred to the concerned specialist.   3. Facilitate and monitor activities related to patient care and set standards for accurate reporting and recording of patient symptoms, reactions and progress.   4. Ensure staff is trained attend to patient emergencies during the dialysis procedure; and are well-versed in basic life support mechanisms like CRP.   5. Work with the Medical Staff to coordinate medical and nursing management of patient care.   6. Organize patient care and ensures continuity of care based upon knowledge of patient needs.   7. Evaluate patient care through assessment, planning intervention, and re-evaluating written documentation, observation and comparison to establish standards.   8. Communicate with patient, significant others and help professionals regarding care to the patient.   9. Provide mechanism to assure patient and significant other participation in care planning.   10. Serve as clinical resource person and assist dialysis personnel in assessing patient.   11. Ensure case details of individual patients are updated regularly; and handed over from shift to shift as per protocol.       Process and Quality     1. Update patient history and dialysis data in Electronic Medical Reports and/ or specific files for current and future reference.   2. Participate in quality assessment and improvement, including utilization and promotion of familiarization with quality improvement standards and programmes   3. Review quality improvement reports and integrate appropriate action.   4. Provide inputs in formulating patient care policy and procedures, for patient care service and the organization.   5. Ensure adherence to NABH standards and other relevant quality standards in all processes.       Staff and Facility Management     1. Provide inputs to Finance to prepare fiscal budgets. Monitor patient revenue, expenses and the operating expenses and provide appropriate reports to authorized person.   2. Ensure overall hygiene and waste management process, as per protocol within the dialysis unit.   3. Promote open communication within the unit and service, plan and conduct unit staff meeting every month; concerns to be reported to the management for adequate redressal   4. Conduct interviewsfor selecting new staff and forward them to the concerned person for finalization   5. Foster professional growth and development of the staff through identification of training needs, sponsoring training programmes, encouraging education (formal and continuing) and assessment   6. Train and mentor junior staff; assist in preparing content for training; orientate them in the protocols and procedures of the dialysis unit.   7. Work along with clinical instructors in planning, implementation and evaluation of staff clinical experience.   8. Responsible for completion of regular performance evaluations for all direct reports; conduct evaluation for new staff prior to completion of probationary period.   9. Plan and maintain adequate staffing in the unit so as to ensure continuity of medical care at all times       Skills and experience:     1. BSc Nursing/ GNM with min. 5 years in Dialysis / Diploma in Dialysis / BSc Dialysis with min 5 years of experience    2. Min. 5 years relevant experience in dialysis with team handling experience.   3. Intermediate computer skills and proficiency in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook required     Salary: Not Disclosed by Recruiter   Industry:Medical / Healthcare / Hospitals   Functional Area: Other   Role:Other       Desired Candidate Profile   Education-     UG: Any Graduate - Any Specialization, B.Sc - Any Specialization, Nursing
column11: Housekeeping, Nursing, GNM, Physiotherapy, Healthcare, PHP, Support services, Troubleshooting, NABH, Facility management
